translation.en: I think it was utilizing a location like Amity Island. It made me feel as if the plot could happen anywhere.

translation.en: That makes sense. Yes, especially the part that it is so famous for. The sound they played whenever they wanted to increase the audience's fear and anxiety.

translation.en: Just another affirmation that Spielberg knew what he was doing even in post-production.

translation.en: No doubt. He is very good at making movies. No, it is not my favorite kind. I am not much into jump scares. I like documentaries. How about you?

translation.en: I like this type of movie around Halloween; otherwise, I enjoy action films.

translation.en: That is understandable. Halloween is a good time to scare yourself.

translation.en: What did you think of the mayor's reaction to the shark attack?
translation.hi_ng: shaark ke hamale par meyar kee pratikriya ke baare mein aapane kya socha?

translation.en: I think it was greedy. I agree it is best not to panic the public, but putting people in danger out of greed is not okay.
translation.hi_ng: mujhe lagata hai ki yah laalachee tha.main maanata hoon ki janata ko ghabaraana nahin chaahie, lekin laalach se logon ko khatare mein daalana theek nahin hai.

translation.en: Exactly, I thought it was neat to think of real world implications both fiscally and morally.
translation.hi_ng: theek, mainne socha tha ki vaastavik duniya ke nihitaarth ko naitik aur naitik roop se donon ke baare mein sochana saaph tha.

translation.en: Of how to present this to the public.

translation.en: Which in the end resulted in a shark-hunting frenzy

translation.en: I like to think of those things too. I did not like that part. I think I would have liked it better if the shark was led out to sea, but most people would probably not enjoy a movie like that, not enough drama.

translation.en: You are right on that.

translation.en: It was nice to see characters such as Brody step up - though it took his son to go into shock in order to spur him to action.

translation.en: I think Spielberg hit the nail on the head as far as portraying small town politics.

translation.en: Yes. It was realistic, though I think much of it applies to politics of all types.
translation.hi_ng: haan. yah yathaarthavaadee tha, haalaanki mujhe lagata hai ki yah sabhee prakaar kee raajaneeti par laagoo hota hai.

translation.en: Money seems to always be highest priority.

translation.en: Unfortunately, true.

translation.en: And sadly we do not get galvanized to action sometimes until tragedy strikes.

translation.en: Have you seen other Spielberg movies?

translation.en: Yes, he has his shining moments and some duds along the way. I feel that more of his movies fall into the former rather than latter category.

I did not like the scuba part. I enjoy enjoy breathing

translation.en: Hi! Today we'll be discussing Batman vs Superman!

translation.en: Great! Do I need to watch any other DC Comic movies prior to watching this one?

translation.en: I can't honestly say, however, as a critic noted "it's better than Man of Steel but not as good as The Dark Knight".

translation.en: Ben Affleck plays Batman/Bruce Wayne, Henry Cavill plays Clark Kent/Superman. Gal Gadot stars in the film as well as Diane Lane as Martha Kent and Amy Adams as Louis Lane. Are you a fan of any of those actors?
translation.hi_ng: Ben Affleck Batmanka Bruce Wayne, Henry Cavill Clark Kent Superman ka role paly ker rhe hai. Gal Gadot film mai Diane Lane Martha Kent ka aur Amy Adams Louis Lane ka role play ker rhe hai. kya tum in actors ke fan ho

translation.en: All but Ben Affleck. Lest super hero movie I saw him in was Daredevil and that was rough. Let's hope he's better in this.

translation.en: Though, I am a Michael Keaton fan when it comes to Batman. I suspect anyone playing Batman who is not Keaton will be weird to me.

translation.en: Most of the critics wasn't too fond of it, but CinemaScore have it a rating of B, which I feel is about right for this film!

translation.en: Have you seen it?

translation.en: I have and would grade it a solid B, just as CinemaScore did. Are you a fan of director Zack Snyder?

translation.en: I'm not sure. What other movies has he directed?

translation.en: He directed Batman vs Superman. The film takes place 18 months after the battle between General Zod and Superman. Superman becomes a controversial figure while Clark Kent learns of Batman's form of justice and seeks to expose him via Daily Planet articles.
translation.hi_ng: Usne Batman V Superman direct ki hai. Wo movie General Zod aur Superman k battle k 18 month baad hoti hai. Superman ek controversial figure ban jata hai aur Clark Kent ko Batman k Justice k tareeke k baare me pata chalta hai aur wo use Daily Planet k articles me expose karna chahta hai

translation.en: Has he directed anything else besides the Batman or Superman movies?

translation.en: I can't honestly say. I know he directed this film while David S. Goyer and Chris Terrio cowrote it.

translation.en: They are - Lex Luthor, who is obsessed with defeating Superman, basically manipulates them into fighting each other.

translation.en: Whose side is Wonder Woman on?

translation.en: Well to be honest, Batman has Superman beat and just before he can kill Superman, Superman utters "save martha" to which Lane enterenters and explains Martha is his mother. Batman rescues Martha while Superman confronts Luther on the scout ship. At this point, Wonder Woman hasn't debuted yet
translation.hi_ng: Well to be honest, Batman Superman ko hara deta hai aur jaise hi wo Superman ko maarne wala rahta hai, Superman bolta hai "save martha" to Lane andar aati hai aur explain karti hai k Martha uski maa hai. Batman Martha ko rescue karta hai aur Superman scout ship pe Luthor ko confront karta hai. Is point pe Wonder Woman ab tak debut nahi ki hai

translation.en:
Dang! Crazy that Batman has Superman beat! Isn't Batman just a millionaire with a lot of fancy gadgets? Superman at least has real super powers. You would think that would give him a one-up. Did Batman have kryptonite
 or something?
translation.hi_ng: Dang! Crazy Batman superman ko hara deta hai. Kya wo bas ek millionaire nahi juske pas bhut fancy gadget hai. Superman k paas at least real super powers hai. Koi bhi sochega k wo superman jeetega. Kya Batman k paas kryptonite ya kuch tha?

translation.en: I do very much agree with you! It is puzzling but Batman has a spear he plans to kill superman with just before he utters the "Save Martha" line, halting Batman from killing him.
translation.hi_ng: main aapase bahut sahamat hoon! yah hairaan karane vaala hai, lekin baitamain ke paas ek bhaala hai, jisase vah suparamain ko maarane kee yojana banaata hai, isase pahale ki vah "sev maartha" lain ka upayog karata hai, baitamain ko maarane se rok deta hai.

translation.en: Do the join forces after that?
translation.hi_ng: kya usake baad sena mein shaamil hote hain?

translation.en: they*
They do thankfully - Batman actually saves Martha while Superman travels to the scout ship to Confront Luther.
translation.hi_ng: ve shukr manaate hain - baitamain vaastav mein maartha ko bachaata hai, jabaki suparamain ka saamana loothar ke saath skaut jahaaj tak jaata hai.

translation.en: Does he kill Luther?
translation.hi_ng: kya vah ko Luther maarata hai?

translation.en: Luther was also the one who kidnapped Martha. He doesn't kill Luther but Luther is arrested to which Batman confronts him while he's in prison, warning that he'll always be watching.
translation.hi_ng: Luther bhee vahee tha jisane maartha ka apaharan kiya tha. vah loothar ko nahin maarata hai, lekin loothar ko giraphtaar kar liya jaata hai, jisamen baitamain ne jel mein rahane ke dauraan usaka saamana kiya, chetaavanee dee ki vah hamesha dekhata rahega

translation.en: So basically leaving an opening for another movie in the franchise?
translation.hi_ng: to mool roop se phrainchaizee mein ek aur philm ke lie ek opaning chhod raha hoon?

translation.en:
I've heard debates on Superman's and Batman's outfits in this movie. Some say that they are awesome and some say that they are ridiculous and too different form their b
eloved originals. What are your thoughts on this?

translation.en: They do... Sadly, Superman dies, however, Bruce Wayne intends to form a team of Metahumans, starting with the Metahumans he found in Luthor's files to protect the world in Sueprmans absence.

translation.en: While it did seem like 153 minutes of a grown man whacking two dolls together, I still found it better than Man of Steel.

translation.en: Wait, Superman dies? How??

translation.en: Well to be honest, at the end of the film, the dirt atop Sueprman's coffin does begin to levitate! I think we're at the finish line! I enjoyed chatting with you about Batman vs Superman! I highly recommend you seeing it one day. If you agree with CinemaScore, they rated it a B so I think you'll enjoy it and encourage you to watch it! Take care and have a great day!

translation.en: What is your opinion on the movie Jaws?
translation.hi_ng: philm joz par aapakee kya raay hai?

translation.en: To be honest, I find shark movies to be terrifying.
translation.hi_ng: sach kahoon, to mujhe shaark philmen bhayaanak lagatee hain.

translation.en: I can't say I blame you. The movie definitely makes that fear worse!
translation.hi_ng: main yah nahin kah sakata ki main tumhen dosh deta hoon. philm nishchit roop se us dar ko badatar bana detee hai!

translation.en: Did you know that this film was based on a book?
translation.hi_ng: Kya tumhe pata hai ki ye film ek book par based hai.

translation.en: No, I didn't. Not surprised though. Most movies tend to be.
translation.hi_ng: Nahi , maine nahi. Lekin mein surprise nahi hun zyadatar movies mein aisa hi hota hai.

translation.en: I do love the Jaws music though.
translation.hi_ng: Lekin Jaws ka music mujhe pasand hai.

translation.en: Agreed, it heightens the tension and makes it scarier, but that's kind of the point.
translation.hi_ng: Agreed, ye tension ko badhata hai aur isko aur daravana banata hai, lekin shayad uska wahi point hai.

translation.en: Are you surprised at how high the rating is for the film's critic score? And if I heard the music while driving, I would think someone was coming to take me out. Haha
translation.hi_ng: Kya aap surprised hain ki is film ki critic score rating itni high hai ? Aur agar mein iska music driving karte samay sunoon to mujhe lagega ki koi mujhe maarne aa raha hai. Haha

translation.en: 97% is incredibly high, I would have thought that there would be at least some people throwing low scores in there somewhere.
translation.hi_ng: 97% bahut zyada high hai , mujhe laga ki kam se kam kuch log to low scores denge.

translation.en: Do you agree that it's a "cheerfully perverse" scare movie?
translation.hi_ng: Kya aap sehmat hai ki ye "cheerfully perverse" daravani movie hai ?

translation.en:
That's what I thought as well. Maybe it's because it was never done before in it's time and was so different when it came out? It might be easier to "give it a pass" 

And I would say it could be "cheerfully perverse" depending on the kind of movies you enjoy.
translation.hi_ng: Mujhe bhi aisa hi lagta hai. Shayad isliye kyunki us zamane mein aisa pehle nahi hua tha aur jo nikal ke aaya wo kafi alag tha ? Usko ""give it a pass" dena easier hoga aur mein kahunga ki ye "cheerfully perverse" depending on aap kaisi movies pasand karte hain.

translation.en: Do you think that it "is too gruesome for children"?
translation.hi_ng: Kya aapko lagta hai ki it "is too gruesome for children"?

translation.en: For small children, yes. I could see them having nightmares.
translation.hi_ng: Chhote bacchon ke liye haan, unko nightmares aa sakte hain.

translation.en: I definitely agree with that. I do find it odd that it is considered a "Thriller" film.
translation.hi_ng: main definitely isase agree karta hoon. Mujhe yah ajeeb lagata hai ki ise ek "Thriller" film maana jaata hai.

translation.en: I think it's interesting that in the key scenes it describes the economic impact on a beach town of the shark attacks. Makes you wonder if they'd cover something like that up to make more money in real life.
translation.hi_ng: mujhe lagata hai ki yah interesting hai ki key scenes mein yah  shark attacks ke ek beach town pareconomic impact ka baare main batata hai. Aapako aashchary hota hai ki kya ve real life mein adhik paisa banaane ke lie aisa kuchh cover karenge.

translation.en: In today's society, I think that would absolutely be the case. Even if there was a bounty hunter hired, they would probably go, "Nothing to see here, have fun!"
translation.hi_ng: aaj ke society mein, mujhe lagata hai ki aisa hee hoga. yahaan tak ​​ki agar ek bounty hunter ko kaam par rakha gaya tha, to ve shaayad bolengain, "yahaan dekhane ke lie kuchh bhee nahin hai, maze karo!"

translation.en: I find it interesting that they put it in a fictional "New England resort town". You would think they would've picked somewhere in California since there's so many beaches and how huge it is.
translation.hi_ng: mujhe yah interesting lagata hai ki unhonne ise fictional  "New England resort town" mein rakha tha. Aapako lagata hai ki ve Californiamein kaheen aur le gae hote kyonki vahaan bahut saare beaches hain aur yah kitana vishaal hai.

translation.en: Agreed, there typically aren't many shark attacks in New England, usually further south or on the west coast.
translation.hi_ng: Main ye maanta hoon ki , aamataur par  New England mein bahut saare shark attacks nahin hote hain, aamataur par south mein ya west coast par.

translation.en: I can't imagine I would keep going to the beach as a tourist if lots of people kept turning up dead.
translation.hi_ng: main imagine nahin kar sakata ki main ek tourist ke roop mein  beacht par jata rahoongan , agar bahut saare log marate hue paaye jate rahein.

translation.en: I agree. The movie is kind of silly the more you think about it. Especially when people keep believing the town and beach team that everything is fine. Yet people keep dying? I guess they want you to suspend disbelief. Haha.
translation.hi_ng: Main agree karta hoon. Movie ek tarah se silly hai , jitana bhi aap isake baare mein sochate hain. khaasakar jab log shahar aur beach team par vishvaas karate rahate ki sab kuchh theek hai.phir bhee log marate rahate hain? mujhe lagata hai ki ve chaahate hain ki aap disbelief ko suspend karen. hah।

translation.en: Or you would think that tourists would join in on the bounty to make the money.
translation.hi_ng: ya aapako lagata hai ki tourists paisa banaane ke lie bounty mein shaamil honge.

translation.en: I wasn't aware that there were so many different types of sharks so near to the shore.
translation.hi_ng: mujhe pata nahin tha ki kinaare ke paas itane saare different type ke sharks the.

translation.en: The key scens describes both a tiger shark and a great white.
translation.hi_ng: key scenes main tiger shark aur ek great white, donon ka varnan kiya gaya hai.

translation.en:
I wonder if the mayor is paid off somewhere in the town or gets a cut of the beaches being open? He's far to adamant about keeping them open. 

And I always thought Tiger Sharks were smaller.
translation.hi_ng: Main soch raha tha ki mayor sheher mein kahin paise leta hai ya beach ke khulne pe? Woh beach kholne par bohot adamant tha. Aur mujhe humesha lagta tha ki Tiger Sharks chotti hoti hain.

translation.en: I always think of Great White's as the huge "Jaws" sharks.
translation.hi_ng: Maine Great Whites ko humesha unn badi "Jaws" sharks ki tarah socha hai.

translation.en: It seems odd that they don't ask a scientist or marine biologist at some point to intervene.
translation.hi_ng: Ajeeb hai ki woh kissi scientist ya marine biologist ko beech mein nahi laa rahe.

translation.en: Even the last key scene describes a pretty limited plan to hook the shark or harpoon it.
translation.hi_ng: Last scene mein bhi bohot hi limited plan hai shark ko hook ya harpoon karne ka.

translation.en: I agree. They have an "Oceanographer" to help determine a shark attack. But no scientists ever get brought in to help the situation.
translation.hi_ng: Sahi, I agree. Unke paas shark attack determine karne ke liye ek "Oceanographer" hai. Par koi scientists nahi laaye help karne ke liye.

translation.en: It seems like a pretty poor plan, and they end up having to make it up as they go along.
translation.hi_ng: Kaafi bekar plan hai, aur aage jaate jaate woh plan banaate jaa rahe hain.

translation.en: It seems crazy that a shark could take out a "Shark-proof" cage.
translation.hi_ng: Kitna crazy hai ki shark ne "shark-proof" cage todd diya.

translation.en: Plus, the reward of only $10,000 seems pretty low to risk lives.
translation.hi_ng: Aur, $10,000 ka reward bohot kam hai life risk karne ke liye.

translation.en: Maybe it was worth a lot more in 1975?
translation.hi_ng: Shayad 1975 mein isse zyaada worth tha.

translation.en: I agree. Not worth it to me. I'll go on vacation in NYC instead and avoid the shark. Haha.
translation.hi_ng: Haan. Mere liye toh worth nahi hai. Shark ko chhod ke, main NYC vacation par chala jaoonga. Haha.

translation.en: And it was definitely worth more in 1975. I just don't know how much.
translation.hi_ng: Aur yeh 1975 Definitely adhik kimat ka hoga.me nahi janti how much.

translation.hi_ng: main un cheejon ka aanand leta hoon jahaan mujhe sochana hai. ya ki ajeeb saajish mod hai. memento kee tarah. ya poorvaabhaas. jahaan aap bahut ant tak sab kuchh nahin samajhate hain.

translation.en: Are there other movies like La La Land that you could compare to it?
translation.hi_ng: kya la la laind jaisee any philmen hain jinase aap isakee tulana kar sakate hain?

translation.en: Cool! Well then you might not like La La Land. It's a bit more straightforward and focuses more on relationships and the characters.
translation.hi_ng: thanda! to phir aap la la laind pasand nahin kar sakate hain. yah thoda adhik seedha hai aur rishton aur paatron par adhik dhyaan kendrit karata hai.

translation.en: I like all kinds of movies. Are there other films that you could compare La La Land to?
translation.hi_ng: mujhe sabhee tarah kee philmen pasand hain. kya aisee any philmen hain jinase aap la la laind kee tulana kar sakate hain?

translation.en: It's kind of a unique type of movie. It has a lot in common with movies from the 1920s that have lots of dance and musical numbers.
translation.hi_ng: yah ek anokhee kism kee philm hai. yah 1920 ke dashak kee philmon ke saath bahut kuchh hai jisamen bahut saare nrty aur sangeet sankhyaen hain.

translation.en: It's very well-made. Lots of critics seem to have enjoyed it.
translation.hi_ng: yah bahut achchhee tarah se banaaya gaya hai. lagata hai ki aalochakon ne isaka bharapoor aanand liya hai.

translation.en: Does it seem interesting?

translation.en: Definitely, it takes place during WWII and it's decrypting spy code messages
translation.hi_ng: jaroor, ye sab during WWII huva tha or it's decrypting spy code messages

translation.en: Cool, is there a main lead actor or actress that's easily identifiable?

translation.en: Yes, it stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Keira Knightly, it's got a pretty good score on Rotten Tomatoes and CinemaScore.
translation.hi_ng: ha, iss me  Benedict Cumberbatch and Keira Knightly hai, is co accha score mila hai Tomatoes and CinemaScore pe

translation.en: Good to know, what studio is it produced by?
translation.hi_ng: good to know, kis studio ne isse produce kiya hai?

translation.en: I'm not sure about that but did you know there was an earlier movie about the same book?
translation.hi_ng: Muze nahi pata uske bareme , per tum ko pata hai kay there was an earlier movie about the same book?

translation.en:
So
 it's based on a book?
translation.hi_ng: to, ye kitap be based hai?

translation.en: Yes, it's based on Alan Turing:  The Enigma and the earlier movie was called Breaking the Code, it was on BBC.
translation.hi_ng: yes, ye based hai Alan Turing: The Enigma or pehele ki movie ka nam tha  Breaking the Code, wo BBC pe thi

translation.en: Good to know, although I didn't ask; does it say who starred in the BBC version?
translation.hi_ng: jaanakaar achchha laga, haalaanki mainne poochha nahin; kya yah kahana hai ki BBC sanskaran mein kisane abhinay kiya

translation.en: No, but I've got info on a few of the key scenes if you're interested in knowing?
translation.hi_ng: nahin, lekin mujhe kuchh pramukh drshyon kee jaanakaaree milee hai yadi aap jaanane mein ruchi rakhate hain?

translation.en: Absolutely, are the scenes taken from the book, the BBC version, or the movie?
translation.hi_ng: poorn roop se, pustak se lie gae drshy hain, BBC sanskaran, ya philm?

translation.en: From the 2014 movie with Cumberbatch and Knightley.  The earliest scene has Turing in boarding school being bullied, and he makes a friend there that gets him interested in cryptography.
translation.hi_ng: 2014 kee philm se kambarabaich aur naitalee ke saath. shuruaatee drshy mein tyooring in bording skool ko badanaam kiya ja raha hai, aur vah vahaan ek dost banaata hai jo use kriptograaphee mein dilachaspee leta hai.

translation.en: That's cool, so it's sort of a biographical movie?
translation.hi_ng: yah achchha hai, to yah ek jeevanee philm kee tarah hai?

translation.en: The next scene is when Britain declares war on Germany, Turing goes to work at a place called Bletchley Park that is trying to decode the Nazi's Enigma Machine.  Yes, it's a historical drama.
translation.hi_ng: agala drshy hai jab briten ne jarmanee par yuddh kee ghoshana kee, tyooring ek jagah par kaam karane jaata hai jise bailechale paark kaha jaata hai vah naajee kee pahelee masheen ko dikod karane kee koshish kar raha hai. haan, yah ek aitihaasik naatak hai.

translation.en: Do you want to hear the plot?
translation.hi_ng: kya aap kathaanak sunana chaahate hain?

translation.en: Does it mention how accurate the movie is as opposed to real-life events; that's why I was asking if it was biographical as opposed to simply historical?
translation.hi_ng: kya yah ullekh karata hai philm vaastavik jeevan kee ghatanaon ke vipareet kitanee sahee hai; isalie main poochh raha tha yadi yah keval aitihaasik ke vipareet jeevanee thee?

translation.en: Oh.  One of the critics says it rearranges the time sequences and invents fictional characters.
translation.hi_ng: oh. ek aalochak kahata hai yah samay drshyon ko punarvyavasthit karata hai aur kaalpanik paatron ko laagoo karata hai.

translation.en:
Thanks for the clarification
, are there any more excerpts?
translation.hi_ng: spashteekaran ke lie dhanyavaad, kya koee aur ansh hain?

translation.en: Yes, the plot sounds really good.  Turing manages to decrypt the Nazi code machine, but the Nazis change the code every day.  So they all realize they can't act on every day's decrypted messages or the Nazis will know that their code machine is useless.
translation.hi_ng: haan, kathaanak vaastav mein achchha lagata hai. tyooring naajee kod masheen ko dikript karane ka prabandhan karata hai, lekin naajiyon ne har din kod badal diya. isalie ve sabhee mahasoos karate hain ki ve har din dikript kie gae sandeshon par kaam nahin kar sakate hain ya naajiyon ko pata chal jaega ki unakee kod masheen bekaar hai.

translation.en: Interesting, does it mention how it's resolved, or does it leave you sort of on the cliff?
translation.hi_ng: dilachasp hai, yah ullekh karata hai ki yah kaise hal ho gaya hai, ya kya yah aapako chattaan par chhodata hai?

translation.en: It kind of leaves a cliffhanger there.  There are a couple of twists, though.
translation.hi_ng: yah vahaan ek kliphanar ko chhod deta hai. haalaanki kuchh jode hain.

translation.en: Does it say whether the main characters survive to the end, or are they wounded, etcetera?
translation.hi_ng: kya yah kahata hai ki kya mukhy paatr ant tak jeevit rahate hain, ya ve ghaayal hote hain, vagairah?

translation.en: It doesn't tell.  One of the twists in the plot is that a Russian spy is discovered by Turing.  Which isn't surprising at first, but then we find out that British intelligence planted him to tell the Russians secrets they wanted them to know, after all Russia and Great Britain were on the same side in WWII.
translation.hi_ng: yah nahin bataata. saajish mein ek tvist yah hai ki tyooring dvaara ek roosee jaasoos kee khoj kee jaatee hai. yah pahalee baar mein aashcharyachakit karane vaala nahin hai, lekin phir hamen pata chala ki british khuphiya ne unhen roos ke rahasyon ko bataane ke lie lagaaya tha, jo ve jaanana chaahate the, aakhirakaar roos aur gret briten wwii mein ek hee taraph the.

translation.en: That's sort of a twisted narrative of the political situation, but whatever, anything else super useful or interesting, (it sounds like a great movie)?
translation.hi_ng: yah raajaneetik sthiti ke ek mod kee tarah hai, lekin jo kuchh bhee, supar upayogee ya dilachasp hai, (yah ek mahaan philm kee tarah lagata hai)?

translation.en: When I watched the movie, I liked the codebreaking machine they had,  It was this massive technical looking wall that was way before the time of WWII.  Yes, there's another twist in the plot where the Russian spy threatens to tell everyone that Turing is homosexual.
translation.hi_ng: jab mainne philm dekhee, to mujhe unake paas kodabreking masheen pasand aaee, yah is vishaal takaneekee dikhane vaalee deevaar thee jo wwii ke samay se pahale thee. haan, saajish mein ek aur mod hai jahaan roosee jaasoos ne sabhee ko yah bataane kee dhamakee dee ki tyooring samalaingik hai.

translation.en: How did the spy know that Turing was gay?
translation.hi_ng: jaasoos ko kaise pata chala ki tyooring samalaingik tha?

translation.en: Turing told the spy, because Turing was about to get married to Clarke (Knightley).  It sounds like high drama to me.  The spy (before Turing realized he was a spy) told Turing to keep his homosexuality a secret.  I guess they were pretty tight.
translation.hi_ng: tyooring ne jaasoos ko bataaya, kyonki tyooring kee shaadee klaark (naitalee) se hone vaalee thee. yah mujhe uchch naatak kee tarah lagata hai. jaasoos (tyooring se pahale ehasaas hua ki vah ek jaasoos tha) ne tyooring ko apanee samalaingikata ko gupt rakhane ke lie kaha tha. mujhe lagata hai ki ve bahut tang the.

translation.en: Wow, that's a big ol' ball of secrecy for that time period, is there anything else about the plot or whatever you should tell me?
translation.hi_ng: vaah, yah us samay kee avadhi ke lie ek badee raajabhaasha gopaneeyata kee gend hai, kya saajish ke baare mein kuchh aur hai ya jo kuchh bhee aapako mujhe bataana chaahie?

translation.en: Yes, at the end of the movie, the Allies win the war and the boss makes the cryptographers promise to never see each other again and they destroy all the code.  Also, Turing tells Clarke (Knightley) to leave because he is scared for her safety.  He tells her he is gay and that he never cared for her, which wasn't true because he was in love with her.
translation.hi_ng: haan, philm ke ant mein, mitr raashtr yuddh jeetata hai aur bos kriptograaphars ko ek doosare ko phir kabhee nahin dekhane ka vaada karata hai aur ve sabhee kod ko nasht kar dete hain. isake alaava, tyooring klaark (naitalee) ko chhodane ke lie kahata hai kyonki vah usakee suraksha ke lie darata hai. vah usase kahata hai ki vah samalaingik hai aur usane kabhee usakee paravaah nahin kee, jo sach nahin tha kyonki vah usake saath pyaar mein thee.

translation.en: I didn't realize I had already seen it until I started reading this.  I remember it was really good.  If a movie isn't good I usually don't recall it this clearly.
translation.hi_ng: I didn't realize I had already seen it until I started reading this. I remember it was really good. If a movie isn't good I usually don't recall it this clearly.

translation.en: It was definitely a good look into what life was like during that horrible war.  It's been good chatting with you, I enjoyed.

translation.en: Yes. I really appreciated how much thought went into the movie's title. I think it's really cool how it refers to Los Angeles, music, and having your head in the clouds all at once. It's really spectacular how they summed up so many elements of the movie in such a short title
translation.hi_ng: Han, maine bht appreciate kiya ki movie ke name ke baare mein kitna socha gya hai. Mujhe achha lga ki kaise ye ek hi baar mein Los Angeles, music, or badalon mein sir dene ke baare mein btata hai. Yeh sach mein bahut badiya hai ki kaise movie ke chhote se titile mein itne saare elements ko pura kiya gya hai.

translation.en: Have you seen it?
translation.hi_ng: Kya tune dekhi hai?

translation.en: yep -  i watched it because critics seemed to like it
translation.hi_ng: han - Maine dekhi kyunki critics ko ye achhi lagi

translation.en: I agree with most of the critics in the paper
translation.hi_ng: Main jyadatar paper ke sabhi critics ke saath agree krta huin

translation.en: Yes. I especially agree with the review that La La Land is successful at showing the hardships that are involved with chasing a dream
translation.hi_ng: Han. Main sabse jyada iss review ke saath agree krta huin ki La La land successful rahi hai sapnon ko pura krne ke liye kiye gye hardships ko dikhane mein.

translation.en: I disagree with the two reviews that the film is dull and that the middle was boring. I really found the entire movie to be enthralling.
translation.hi_ng: Mein unn do reviews se asahmat hu jinhone likha tha ki film dull hai aur beech ka part boring hai. Mujhe sach mein poori film enthralling lagi.

translation.en: yep, i agree with you - i do believe we have to cut emma stone and ryan gosling some slack, since they're not singers
translation.hi_ng: han, mein aapse sehmat hu - mein ye maanta hu ki humko emma stone aur ryan gosling ko kuch slack kaatna chahiye kyuki wo singers nahi hain

translation.en: Agreed. I really liked the scene where Sebastian improvs jazz music when he is supposed to be playing Christmas music only.
translation.hi_ng: Han, meine mana. Mujhe wah scene bohat achha laga jahan Sebastian jazz music improv karta hai jabki usko sirf Christmas music play karna chahiye.

translation.en: It was one of those scenes that really stuck with me after I watched the movie
translation.hi_ng: Ye unmein se ek scene tha jo film dekhne k baad bhi mere sath chipka reh gaya.

translation.en: would you do that, if you were in his position?
translation.hi_ng: tum kya karte, agar tum uski position mein hote?

translation.en: I'm not sure. I liked how that was when Mia first heard Sebastian sing and was truly moved by it. I think it was interesting way to initiate their relationship
translation.hi_ng: Mujhe sure nahi hu. Mujhe yah pasand aaya ki jab Mia ne pehli baar Sebastian ko gaate huye suna aur wo sach mein uss se move ho gayi. Mujhe lagta hai ye unki relationship ko start karne a interesting way tha.

translation.en: yeah, it was just sad how he brushed her off, since things could've been different
translation.hi_ng: han, ye sad tha ki usne usko brush off kar dia, warna baatein kuch alag hi hoti

translation.en: I do like how the next time Mia sees Sebastian he is also singing. I also liked how she kind of teased him by requesting a song she knew he would hate to sing
translation.hi_ng: Mujhe ye achha laga ki jab next time Mia ne Sebastian ko dekha wo bhi gana ga raha hai.  Mujhe ye bhi pasand aaya ki usne usko ek aisa gana request karke chidhaya kyuki usko pata tha ki usko wo gana gana achha nahi lagega

translation.en: do you usually watch musicals?
translation.hi_ng: Tum usually musicals dekhte ho?

translation.en: Occasionally. I also enjoyed the development of Sebastian and Mia's relationship, such as when Mia decides to begin writing a play all by herself because Sebastian suggests it to her. I feel like the two of them really grow as individuals when they get into a relationship
translation.hi_ng: kabhi kabhi.  Mujhe bhi Sebastian aur Mia ki relationship ka development achha laga, jaise jab Mia decide karti hai ki ab wo akele hi play karegi kyuki Sebastian ne usko aisa suggest kia. Mujhe laga ki wo dono bohat grow karte hain as individuals jab wo relationship mein aa jate hain

translation.en: I enjoyed that part too, since it also shows how hard both of them are working to achieve their dreams
translation.hi_ng: maine woh part bhi enjoy kiya, kyon ki yeh dikhata hai kitna hard ye donon kaam kar rahen hain apne dreams achieve karne ke liye

translation.en: they both want to become successful in their separate areas, but they have to struggle a lot
translation.hi_ng: donon chahte hain ki successful banen apne seperate ares mein, lekin bahut struggle karna padega

translation.en: Right. I feel like the review that mentions the cruelty that's involved in following your dreams really sums it up. The film is not afraid to show how much hard work and hardship is involved in making it big
translation.hi_ng: Right. lagta hai review jo cruelty ko mention karta hai dreams ko follow karten hai sum karta hai.film afraid nahin karta hai ki kitna hard work aur hardship involve karta hai bada hasil karne ke liye

translation.en: i also thought it was difficult for sebastian to take keith's offer
translation.hi_ng: mujhe bhi laga ki sebastian keo keith ka offer difficult laga

translation.en: i mean, he gets paid, but it's not something he wants to do. This happens in life a lot
translation.hi_ng: mera matlab hai, use payment milta hai lekin woh hai nahin karna chahta hai.  ye bahut hota hai life mein

translation.en: I agree. It must be hard to do something you're not passionate about- especially when it's something you must do in order to one day live out your dreams
translation.hi_ng: main agree karta hoon. hard lagta hoga kuch karne kojab tum passionate nahin hoge- especially jab tumhe kuch karna hoga tumhe ek din live karna hai dreams ke liye

translation.en: What did you think of the scene when Mia and Sebastian get into a fight about Mia thinking Sebastian is giving up on his dreams?
translation.hi_ng: kya laga tumhe woh scene jab Mia or Sebastian fight karne lage jo Mia soch rahi thi Sebastian drams ko chod raha hai?

translation.en: it was definitely well acted, and i sympathize with both of them
translation.hi_ng: usme ekdum acchi acting thi, lekin sympathize karta hoon donon se

translation.en: but i think sebastian was harsh when he said that mia liked him more when he was unsuccessful
translation.hi_ng: mujhe lagta hai sebastian harsh tha jab usne mia se kaha ki woh use aur pasand karta tha jab woh unsucessful tha

translation.en: It truly was heartbreaking when Mia moved back home to Nevada
translation.hi_ng: truly woh heartbreaking thi jab Mia vapas Nevada ghar mein gayi

translation.en: i feel he didn't want to hear the truth, because he was really giving up on his dreams
translation.hi_ng: muje lagtha hein ki voh sach jaan ne mein hiskis hein, kyon ki voh apna dream ko give up karta hein

translation.en: it really was sad
translation.hi_ng: voh toh bura huva

translation.en: I agree. It was also a very unpredictable plot twist. I did not see it coming at all
translation.hi_ng: mein maantha hoon. voh toh unpredictable plot twist tha. muje toh patha hi nahi chala ki voh aap raha hein

translation.en: would you say that was the low point in the movie?
translation.hi_ng: kya tuje aisa laga ki voh low point ka movie hein?

translation.en: Yes but I wouldn't say any part of the movie "sagged badly" as one review claims
translation.hi_ng: haan, lakin  muje lag raha hai ki koi sagged badly ko review karega

translation.en: i agree - overall, i would recommend the movie to a friend
translation.hi_ng: haan maantha hoon, overall mein toh apni friend ko is movie ko recommend karunga

translation.en: I agree. As another review points out it was a "genuinely romantic comedy", which I completely agree with because I feel as though Sebastian and Mia's relationship was not as cliche as many love stories are in movies. I appreciated the realness of their relationship
translation.hi_ng: mein bhi. toh dusra review point mein toh voh "genuinely romantic comedy" bola tha , jo mein completely agree karunga kyon ki muje lagtha hei ki Sebastian aur Mia ka relationship toh cliche nahi hein jo love stories mein huva hota hein. lakin voh relationship toh mein realness se appreciate karunga

translation.en: yes, that was one thing i loved about the movie - while it was sad, it was not a cliche ending

translation.en: Hi
translation.hi_ng: hi

translation.en: This movie is about how Facebook got started by Mark Zuckerberg, it's called "The Social Network". Interesting to watch because it's based on real events.
translation.hi_ng: Mark Zuckerburg ne Facebook kaise start kiya movie is baare me hai, iska naam hai "The Social Network". Dekhne me bahut interesting hai kyonki ye real events pe based hai.

translation.en: I have heard of that movie before
translation.hi_ng: maine is movie ke baare me pahle bhi suna hai

translation.en: Although I haven't watched it before
translation.hi_ng: Although maine pahle dekhi nahi hai

translation.en: It was more popular than the book it was based on, The Accidental Billionaires, probably because it's a tale of Sex, Money, and Betrayal. Stuff we can all identify with
translation.hi_ng: Yah jis kitab par yah aadharit hai usse bhi jyada popular hai, The Accidental Billionaires, probably because ye kahani hai Sex, Money aur dhokhe ki, wo stuff jiske sath ham sab identify karte hai.

translation.en: Oh that is really interesting
translation.hi_ng: oh yah to really interesting hai

translation.en: It makes it sound more intriguing than before
translation.hi_ng: yah to pahle se jyada intriguing sound kar raha hai

translation.en: Have you seen it
translation.hi_ng: kya aapne dekhi hai

translation.en: Yes, we've all heard of Facebook, but the story of how it got started is pretty surprising. I didn't believe everything I saw in the movie, but it held my interest
translation.hi_ng: yes, ham sabne Facebook ke bare me suna hai, but ye shuru kaise hua uski story kafi surprising hai. movie me jo dekha us sab par believe to nahi hua, par mera interest isme bana raha

translation.en: I think sometimes they add information to movies just to keep the audience entertained
translation.hi_ng: I think sometime ye movie me kuch information sirf ise interesting aur audience ko entertained rakhne ke liye karte hai.

translation.en: Which is understandable because you don't want a boring movie
translation.hi_ng: Ye understandable hai because koi bhi boring movie nahi chahta.

translation.en: I had no idea it was a book thogh
translation.hi_ng: mujhe bilkul idea nahi tha ke wo book hai

translation.en: No doubt, It is a drama. Zuckerberg and the current staff weren't involved in making the movie, it has a kind of dark irony, but one of the founders, Eduardo Saverin, was consulted by the book's author.

translation.en: I am sure there is information that they didn't want to leak in the movie and even the book

translation.en: So would you recommend seeing this movie? It a couple of years old if not older.
translation.hi_ng: toh kya aap ye movie dekhna recommend karte hai? ye kuch saal puraani hai agar aur zyada puranni nahi hai toh

translation.en: Yes, it's an engaging look at that time period when websites were just getting started. Some of the lawsuits that came out of those beginnings might still be on going.

translation.en: I believe it. I remember reading about the lawsuits when they were filed. I think they have great lawyers to protect themselves though...
translation.hi_ng: mujhe yaqeen hai. mujhe yaad hai  maine padha tha jub lawsuits file hue thay. mere khayal se unke pass khud ko bachanay ache lawyers hai

translation.en: The film starts in 2003 when Zuckerberg was a 19 year old student at Harvard. He actually created a campus website called Facemash that allowed users to rate the attractiveness of photos of female students.
translation.hi_ng: film shuru hoti hai 2003 mein jub Zuckerberg  19 saal ka student  tha Harvard mein. usne asal Facemash naam ki campus website banayi jisme users female students ke photos ke attractiveness  ko rate kar sakte thay

translation.en:
That is a really good overall description for someone who wants a synapse
 of the movie.
translation.hi_ng: ye puray taur par bahut acha description  hai unlog ke liye jinko movie ka synapse  chahiye

translation.en: Oh, that's just the beginning. That website was so popular it got the attention of the Winklevoss twins, who were upper class men who made a dating website exclusive to Harvard.  So the origins of the idea for the site are kind of vague
translation.hi_ng: Oh,wo toh bus shuruat hai. wo website itni popular hai ke isko Winklevoss twins ka attention mila,jo  upper class men thay jinho ne Harvard ke liye exclusive  dating website banayi

translation.en: Is the company protected by a patent or some kind of legal documents?
translation.hi_ng: kya company kuch patent ya legal documents ki hifazat me hai

translation.en: I don't know, but Zuckerberg was given 6 months academic probation for hacking into college databases and crashing the Harvard computer network. So he's aware of what kind of damage a rogue programmer can do.
translation.hi_ng: Main nahi jaanta, par Zukerbreg ko college database ko hack karne aur harward computer network ko crash karne ke liye 6 months ka academic probation mila tha. So wo is baat se aware hoge ki rogue programmer kis prakar ka damage kar sakte hai.

translation.en: As a programmer I could see the damage that can be done by hacking into databases and networks.
translation.hi_ng: As a programmer me ye dekh sakta hun ki databases aur networks me hacking se jo nuksaan ho sakta hai.

translation.en: damage was bound to happen in this situation
translation.hi_ng: damage is situation me hone ke liye bounded tha.

translation.en: So you also know that programming knowledge doesn't necessarily translate to business smarts. It's when Zuckerberg gets hooked up with Napster co-founder Sean Parker that the business really starts to take off
translation.hi_ng: So tum bhi ye jaante ho ki business ko smart translate karne ke liye programming ka knowledge necessary nahi hai. Ye jab zukerberg ne Napster ke co-founder sean parker se hooked up kiya, is se business really me take off karna start karta hai.

translation.en:
I had totally forgotten about using Napster. I use to always use it. Had no idea he co-f
ounded it.
translation.hi_ng: Me Npaster ko use karne ke baare me totally bhool gaya tha. Me use hamesa use karne ka aadi hun. Mujhe koi idea nahi ki wo iska co-founder hai

translation.en: There were other social networks before The Facebook, too, which is what Zuckerberg called it while expanding the site to Yale, Columbia, and Stanford. I liked Napster, too, and had a MySpace account.  But that all changed after Parker suggested they drop 'The' and move Facebook to Palo Alto.
translation.hi_ng: Facebook ke pehle bhi other social networks the, jo ki zuckerberg ne kaha tha jab wo site ko yale, columbia aur stanford me expand kar rahe the. Mujhe Nepster bhi pasand hai, aur mera Myspace ka account bhi hai. But ye sab badal gaya jab parker ne suggest kiya facebook to palo alto.

translation.en:
I I also had a MySpace account but haven't logged in roughly
 2 years.
translation.hi_ng: Mere pass bhi Myspace account hai par maine kabhi hi 2 years me logged in kiya.

translation.en: Been a while for me, too.  Parker ended up sharing a house in Palo Alto with Zuckerberg, leaving his partner Saverin in New York to work on "Business Development". Meanwhile they were developing plans for the business in California to make a billion dollar company.
translation.hi_ng: Mere liye thodi der ho gayi. Paker ne zuckerberg ke saath house sharing khatm kar di Palo alto me, apne partner saverin ko new york me hi business development ka kaam karne ke liye chhod diya. Meanwhile wo california me billion dollar ki company  ke business plan ko develop karne lage.

translation.en: That is crazy. To have potentially in a company to make a billion dollar company is mind blowing
translation.hi_ng: Ye crazy tha. Unke pass company ko million dollar ki company banane ka potential hai jo ki mind blowing hai.

translation.en: Well, Saverin and the Winklevoss twins tried to keep their interests in the company. The film is intercut with scenes from their depositions in the cases against Zuckerberg. They eventually settled out of court because Zuckerberg's defense thinks he will appear unsympathetic to a jury.
translation.hi_ng: Well, Saverin aur Winklevoss judwa ne apan interests company me rakhne ka try kiya. Film me un scenes ko intercut kar diya jisme Zuckerberg ke against deposition case the. Unhone eventually court ke bahar hi settle kar liya, zukerberg ke defense sochte hai ki wo jury ko unsympathetic appear hoge.

translation.en:
Well if he wasn't going to seem unsympathetic
 than maybe it was the best choice for the defense
translation.hi_ng: tho, agar voh unsympathetic ke liye nahi jaayega tho defense he uska best choice rehega

translation.en: No doubt, the film has lots of sordid details about the founding and the callous attitude Zuckerberg had towards his collaborators. But the end, when he's sending a friend request, is when it get's really weird.
translation.hi_ng: no doubt, film mein tho kahi sordid details hein us founding aur callous ka attitude ke baare mein, zuckerberg tho us collaborators ke sa saath hein.. lekin end mein, jab usne usko friend ko request diya tho thoda weird feel huva

translation.en: Ugh I hate endings that either leave cliff hangers or just ends with no explanation of the future events
translation.hi_ng: ugh, mein end hate kartha kyon ki voh cliff hangers ko nahi choda aur end mein kuch explanation bhi nahi diya us future events ko

translation.en: I hear you. This ending has to deal with a world where Superman is absent, and after every one leaves, the dirt on top of Clark's coffin starts rising into the air. How about that!

translation.en: I agree, it was a very safe bet for Pixar with how they presented it.

translation.en: I agree, it has enough stuff to haunt the imagination long after the immediate buzz of cuteness has melted away. For a mere prequel, that's a good result.

translation.en: I liked the whole fraternity aspect of it, very tongue in cheek.

translation.en: Yes, it was a refreshing outlook on the series as a whole and provided a nice background for the characters.

translation.en: I thought the scene of Mike at 7 years old was a good call-back too.

translation.en: I also like how they show the friendship between Mike and Sully develop

 background compared to other characters. It explains why only he was accepted into Roar Omega Roar.

translation.en: True, and it does do a good job of showing how both characters are flawed.
translation.hi_ng: Sach, aur ye ye dikhane ka acha kaam karti hai ki dono characters flawed hain.

translation.en: I thought the whole Scare Games plot was a fairly good one too, kept it interesting.
translation.hi_ng: mery khyal k mutabiq tamam khofnak game ka plot kafi achaa bhi tha, bht dilchasp rakha

translation.en: I agree, I like that they didn't try to make them perfect.

translation.en: Yes! And so much was at stake for them in that game as well

translation.en: I agree, I felt bad for Mike who thought he succeeded on his own terms but instead was helped to win

translation.en: I thought it was ironic too since they only get eliminated from the first challenge because another team was diqualified for cheating.

translation.en: Yes I agree. It ended up causing them to become expelled from the university as well

translation.en: I feel like the struggle between the media and the people in power is always relevent
translation.hi_ng: MUJE FEEL HOTA KI YEK POWER KELIYE MEDIA AUR PEOPLE DONO STRUGGLE KARTE JO RELEVANT HEIN

translation.en: Yeah. It was interesting to see how the court case played out and how the newspapers sort of stood together.

translation.en: I I think seeing it a second time would be helpful to pick up the little things I might have missed. I'm not sure I would categorize it as calculated. It was intense, but I thought in a good way.

translation.en: Apparently Ellsberg overheard Robert McNamara saying he thought the war was hopeless, even though he was telling the public it was going well, and he became disillusioned about that and decided to leak the truth.

translation.en: Yep, well  a military analyst, Ellsberg is in Vietnam during combat and documents the activities for the secretary of defense but when he realizes that the secretary believes the US is going to win the war, he is disappointed because he doesn't agree. Years later he photocopies classified reports and releases them.
translation.hi_ng: yep, yeh military analyst hein,  vietnam mein ellsberg hein jab combat aur uska activities ka documents us secretary of defence ne liya lekin jab voh realizes kiya th aki secretary us ko war jithne ko jaana hein believe kiya tho voh usse maane pe disappointment kiya, later, voh photocopies ka reports classified kiya aur release ki

translation.en: Who plays Ellsberg?

translation.hi_ng: sorry, bob odenkirk editor play karta hai, Hanks Ben Bradlee nam ka banda play karta hai, janta nahi ellsberg kon play karta hai. post ko kafi mushkil ho rahi hogi ye decide karne mein ki isey publish karein kya nahi, nixon administration ne uske against charges le aaye

translation.en: Yes, the editor Katharine Graham knew that she had to decide whether to publish or not, if she did, she could be charged with contempt of the court and if she published, she would establish the washington post as a very importan journalistic institution
translation.hi_ng: Han, editor Katharine Graham ko pata tha ki usey decide karna padega ki isey publish karein ya nahi, agar wo karegi, wo contempt of the court ke liye charge ho sakti hai aur agar wo publish karegi, to wo washington post ko importan joturnalistic institution ki tarah establish karta hai.

translation.en: she was the heir of the newspaper so she considered it a family legacy
translation.hi_ng: Wo newspaper ki heir thi to wo usko apni family legacy samajhti thi

translation.en: Gosh, that seems like history never changes. Government always trying to silence the press.
translation.hi_ng: Gosh, aisa lagta hai jaise history never changes. Government always trying to silence the press.

translation.en: Exactly! The White House retaliated and ordered the post and the NYT to appear before the supreme court to pled their first amendment to publish the story
translation.hi_ng: Exactly!  White House ne retaliate kiya aur the post aur  NYT ko order diya to appear before the supreme court to pled their first amendment story ko publish karne ke liye

translation.en: Good for them!
translation.hi_ng: Accha hai for them !

translation.en: the supreme court ruled 6-3 in favor of the newspapers, which vindicated Graham's decision.
translation.hi_ng: Supreme court ne newspapers ke favor mein 6-3 se decision diya,  which vindicated Graham's decision.

translation.en: Hello, how are

translation.en: you doing?
translation.hi_ng: aap kar rahe hai?

translation.en: Hi!  I'm doing well, thanks!
translation.hi_ng: hi! main accha kar raha hun, thanks!

translation.en: So, what did you think of the blind side?
translation.hi_ng: so, aapne blind side ke baare me kya socha?

translation.en:
I love sports documentaries, so I favored this movie. H
ow about you?
translation.hi_ng: mujhe sports documentaries pasand hai, So main in movies ka favor karta hun, Aapka baare me kya hai?

translation.en: It was quite good.  I'm not surprised it got such good reviews on Cinemascore
translation.hi_ng: Ye quite good tha. Main surprised nahi hun ki ise cinemascore me itne acche reviews mile

translation.en: Same here. It is a little odd that it got lower reviews on other platforms like Metacritic. I take it you like sports docs too?
translation.hi_ng: Same here. Ye little odd hai ki ise dusre platforms par lower reviews mile jaise ki Metacritic. Main apko sports docs ki tarah leta hun?

translation.en: Yes, very much.  It's surprising how much adversity Oher had to overcome, don't you think?
translation.hi_ng: Yes, bahut had tak. Main surprise hun ki kitne adversity Oher ko kam karni padegi, aapko nahi lagta?

translation.en: Yeah, It must've been really difficult on him. I wonder how he felt having to relive his experience through the movie. I don't know how I would handle it.
translation.hi_ng: Yeah, ye nischit hi unhe liye kafi difficult hoga. I wonder kaise unhone is movie ke dwara apne experience ko relive karna mahsoos kiya hoga. Main nahi jaanta ki main ise kaise handle karuga.

translation.en: Did you like Sandra Bullock in the movie?
translation.hi_ng: kya tumhe Sandra Bullock is movie me pasand aayi?

translation.en: Yeah, Bullock was great.  Although, she's a great actor so I think she does well in most of her roles
translation.hi_ng: Hann, Bullock great thi.  Waise bhi, woh great actor hai and zyadatar roles mein achcha hi karti hai.

translation.en: Totally agree. Easy to see why the critics applauded her performance
translation.hi_ng: Main totally manta hoon.  Easily dikhta hai critics kyon use performance ko applaud karte hain.

translation.en: Any thoughts on any of the other actors? I had forgotten Tim McGraw was in the movie, haha
translation.hi_ng: Doosre actors ke baare mein kya thoughts hain?  Main bhook gaya tha ki Tim McGraw bhi movie mein tha, haha.

translation.en: I thought Quinton Aaron was very good, too.
translation.hi_ng: Mujhe laga Quinton Aaron bhi bahut achcha tha.

translation.en: It must have been tough to go through foster care so much, but I think it's good that Oher found something to latch on to in football.
translation.hi_ng: Foster care se guzarna bahut mushkil hua hoga, par achchi baat hai football mein Oher ko naya sahara mila.

translation.en: Yeah, he certainly excelled in it. I think he was able to apply his protective qualities in his personality to football
translation.hi_ng: Haan, usne bahut hi achcha pradarshan kiya.  Mujhe lagta hai usne apne personality ke protective qualities to football mein dikhaya.

translation.en: Definitely.  He was also very lucky to finally find a good foster family.  It's super difficult to find a good family that cares about their foster kids.
translation.hi_ng: Bilkul.  Woh bahut lucky tha ki use achcha foster family mil gayi.  Ek achche family ka milna bahut mushkil hai jo apne foster kids ka care karti hai.

translation.en: Yeah, I would imagine that it's hard. I feel like that's why it was such agood movie. Nothing seemed to be all that good in his life until he found a family that would treat him like one of their own
translation.hi_ng: Haan, yeh kitna hard hai, main samaj sakta hoon.  Mujhe lagta hai yeh movie isi liye itna achcha laga.  Uski zindagi mein kuch bhi achcha nahin tha jab tak us family ko usne dekha jo use apna samajte the,

translation.en: What do you think of the idea of "protective instincts" and how it influenced Oher's behavior?
translation.hi_ng: Tumhe  "protective instincts" idea kaise lagta hai aur is idea ne Oher ke behavior ko kaise influence kiya?

translation.en: I remember he ranked very high when he was taking his career test. It definitely translated well into his efforts in football. Do you think that helped his family as well?
translation.hi_ng: Mujhe yaad hai uska rank bahut achcha tha jab woh career test le raha tha.  Yeh rank use football mein achche efforts dalne me kaam aya.  Kya tumhe lagta hai ki is se uski family ko bhi help mili?

translation.en: I'm sure it did.  It's ironic, though, that he has such strong protective instincts when he was abandoned by his mother. Do you think he was overcompensating?
translation.hi_ng: Main sure hoon aisa hi hua.  Magar, usme itna stron protective instincts hain jabki usi maa ne use abandon kar diya tha.  Kya tumhe lagta hai ki woh overcompensate kar raha tha?

translation.en: How did you feel about the scene where Collins adopts Oher?
translation.hi_ng: Tumhe woh scene kaise laga jahan Collins Oher ko adopt karta hai?

translation.en:
As for being overcompensating, that he was not. I think that was built naturally in him, where he was not consciously
 trying to do it.
translation.hi_ng: Mujhe nahin lagta ki woh overcompensate kar raha tha.  Mujhe lagta hai yeh usme naturally built hai aur woh consciously karne ki koshish nahin kar raha tha.

translation.en: How did you feel about the scene where Collins adopts Oher?
translation.hi_ng: Tumhe woh scene kaise laga jahan Collins Oher ko adopt karta hai?

translation.en: I think LeighAnne's friends were concerned that Collins would not be safe around him.
translation.hi_ng: Mujhe lagta hai  LeighAnne ke friends concerned the ki Collins uske paas safe nahin rah paayega.

translation.en: I think that was probably a tough choice for the family to make as a whole.
translation.hi_ng: Mujhe lagta hai as a whole, woh shayad family ke liye ek tough choice tha.

translation.en: Do you think going to Ole Miss was a good decision?
translation.hi_ng: Kya tumhe lagta hai ki Ole Miss jaana ek achcha decision tha?

translation.en: Yeah in the long run, he felt like he had family there. Do you think that he meant his mother at all in that choice?
translation.hi_ng: Haan, anth mein, use laga ki uski family wahan thi. Kya tumhe lagta hai ki uski choice mein uski mother bhi shaamil thi?

translation.en: Probably not because she was a drug addict.  I think he was referring to his adopted family.
translation.hi_ng: Nahin ho sakta kyonki woh ek drug addict thi. Mujhe lagta hai woh apni adopted family ke baare mein bata raha tha.

translation.en: How do you think the gang leader in his old town affected him?
translation.hi_ng: Tumhe kya lagta hai ki uske old town ke gang leader ka uspar kya asar hua?

translation.en: I think that was what grew his protective instincts even more. He was worried what might happen to his adoptive family when Leigh Anne and Collins were threatened by the gang leader.
translation.hi_ng: mujhe lagta hai usse hi uske protective instinct aur grow kar gaye. Jab gang leader ne Leigh Anne aur Collins ko dhamkaya to wo chinta me tha k uske adoptive family ko kya hoga

translation.en: Do you think he made the right decision to fight back?
translation.hi_ng: Kya tumhe lagta hai uska fight back karne ka decision sahi tha?

translation.en: Yeah, definitely, you have to protect yourself!
translation.hi_ng: Haan, definitely, tumhe khud ko to bachana hi hoga

translation.en: Absolutely, I think he felt more of a connection with his adoptive family than with his own!
translation.hi_ng: Absolutely, mujhe lagta hai uska apni khudki family se jyada adoptive family se connection hai.

translation.en: Definitely, and who wouldn't.  I don't understand why people are so connected to their blood relatives if they weren't around to be part of their family
translation.hi_ng: Definitely, kiska nahi hoga. Mujhe ye nahi samjh me aata log apne blood relative se itna connected kyu rahte hai bhale he wo family ka part banne k liye paas me nahi the

translation.en: Yep. It seems like the Tuohy family accepted him and made him feel like he belonged there with him.
translation.hi_ng: Haan, aisa lagta hai ki Tuohy family ne use accept kiya aur aisa feel karwa k jaise wo unke saaath hi belong karta hai

translation.en: Good conversation, thanks for chatting!
translation.hi_ng: Accha conversation, chat karne k liye thanks

translation.en: Is your document about the movie "The Social Network?"
translation.hi_ng: Kya tumhara document movie "The Social Network" ke baare mein hai?

translation.en: Yes it's about The social Network
translation.hi_ng: Han ye The social Network ke baare mein hai

translation.en: Cool, so we're on the same document.  You know it's got a score of 96% on Rotten Tomatos.  It's pretty darn good.
translation.hi_ng: Cool, to hai ek hi document pe hai. Tumhe pta hai kya ki isse 96% mile hai Rotten Tomatoes pe. Yehn bahut achha hai.

translation.en: Yeah the rating is pretty good. Do you check the rating of a movie before you watch it?
translation.hi_ng: Haan rating bahut achhi hai. Kya tum movie dekhne se pehle bhi rating check krte ho?

translation.en: I usually do.  I normally check the Metacritic Score.  Since this one was 95/100 I figured it would be pretty good.  Did you know that Amie Hammer played two roles?
translation.hi_ng: Main aamtaur pe krta huin. Main Metacritic ka score check krta huin. Chunki yeh 95/100 tha, mujhe lagta hai ye bahut achha score hai. Kya tumhe pta hai ki Amie Hammer ne do roles play kiye hai?

translation.en: I never noticed. Must be a very good actor.
translation.hi_ng: Maine kabhi dhayan nhi diya. Zarur baht achha actor hoga.

translation.en: Well, if you look at the document, he played both Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss.
translation.hi_ng: Ok, agar tum document deko to, usne dono Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss ko play kiya hai.

translation.en: Do you think Mark Zuckerberg really behaved like the actor in the movie?
translation.hi_ng: Tumhe lagta hai ki Mark Zuckerberg ne ek actor ki tarah behave kiya hai movie mein?

translation.en: Jesse Eisenberg did a good job of playing the brilliant hero, Founder Mark Zuckerberg.  I thought it was exciting and instinctivly perceptive.
translation.hi_ng: Jesse Eisenberg ne bahut achha kaam kiya hai brilliant hero ka role play krke, Founder Mark Zuckerberg. Mujhe laga ki yeh romaanchak aur sahaj perceptive hai.

translation.en: I think Justine Timberlake should stick to singing. I didn't buy his role for one second. Did you?
translation.hi_ng: Mujhe lagta hai ki Justin Timberlakeko singing hi krte rehna chahiye. Maine ek second ke liye unki bhoomika nahin kharidi. kya tumane?

translation.en: You know the character of Mark Zuckerberg was only 19 and he basically started Facebook after being dumped by his girlfriend.
translation.hi_ng: jab mark zuckerberg 19 ke they tab unhone facebook ko start kiya, tab uska girlfriend unhe dumped kiya tha

translation.en: Yeah. That was a really shallow move by Mark. Though I bet she regrets it now.
translation.hi_ng: acha,, voh tho vaakahi mein shallow move hein mark ko.. lekin voh ache regret karke hogi

translation.en: Regret is speculative.  The movie's main source was a book called "The Accidental Billionaires" which was was a contentious book that may or may not be believed.
translation.hi_ng: regret tho speculative hein.. is movie ka main source hein book jo" the accidental billionaires" , jinme kahi maanthe hein

translation.en: Do you agree with the CinemaScore Rating?
translation.hi_ng: kya aap ko cinema score ka rating par bharosha hein?

translation.en: Yes. I totally agree on the rating. It really was a good movie
translation.hi_ng: haan, mein unka rating totally agree kartha.. voh vaakahi mein ache movie hein

translation.en: You know the whole Facebook Experiment started out as a way to increase the dating pool for Harvard students.
translation.hi_ng: yeh whole facebook ka experiment tho us harvard students ke liye banaya gaya hein, jo dating pool ko increase karne ke

translation.en: Yeah i can see that. Do you think it worked?
translation.hi_ng: haan muje dekh raha hein.. kya yeh work hoga?

translation.en: I don't think people from Harvard have trouble getting dates.  Do you remember who Andrew Garfield played?
translation.hi_ng: muje nahi lagtha hey ki harvard ko trouble hoga dates ko paane mein.. kuch andrew garfield ka play yaad hein?

translation.en: I really don't. I was surprised to find out how the name facebook came about. Do you think Christy Lee brags about it?
translation.hi_ng: nahi yar.. muje tho surprised huva jab facebook ka naam bahar aaya tho.. tho christy lee ke brags ke baare mein kya soch raha hein?

translation.en: Perhaps.  I found it interesting that before Facebook, it was called "The Facebook."  Do you remember the co-founder of Napster?
translation.hi_ng: tho facebook tho interesting hein, mein tho usse THE FACEBOOK hi bolta , kya aapko napster ka cofounder yaad hein?

translation.en: Yes. He actually made them drop "The" from the name to become just Facebook.
translation.hi_ng: Han. Usne vaastav mein "The" ko nam se hta diya sirf Facebook banane ke liye.

translation.en: Do you remember where they moved to in California when they started the company?

translation.en: I believe they used the house as the company headquarters.
translation.hi_ng: Mujhe lagt hai ki unhone ghar ka use kiya tha company headquarters ke taur par.

rk Zuckerberg got?

translation.en: Rotten tomatoes gives it 59 percent. I guess that means they say it's an ok kind of move. I remember the boxing robots though.

translation.en: The deal where the winner gets the loser's robot seems a bit extreme

translation.en: Yeah, that was nice while it lasted. Seems to have dried up though

translation.en: I live in Ohio and I hear about those "credits" for movies being made here. Normally I'd watch Hugh Jackman in other movies.

translation.en: He's a decent actor.

translation.en: I'm reading through here looking for interesting facts about the movie. It says the film's based on a short story called "Steel" which was orginally published in 1956, later adapted into a Twilight Zone episode in 1963. Now that's interesting. The old Twilight Zone shows frightened me. lol
translation.hi_ng: mein is movie ka interesting facts ko read karne ki koshis kar rahi thi.. isme likh hein ki, yeh film short story se based hein aur steel ka originally published kiya hein jo 1956 mein released, later twilight zone us episode ko 1963 ko adapt kiya, ab interesting hein, purana twilight zone tho kitna frightened hein. lol

translation.en: I love old Twilight Zone but don't recall the one this is based on

Gru steals a shrink ray fro
m Vector and becomes responsible for some children named Margo, Edith, and Agnes

translation.en: I personally have watched this movie. I thought it was super cute and it can be related to general life.

translation.en: Yes the short reviews at the bottom suggest it is thought provoking.
translation.hi_ng: ha, ye neeche chota reviews hi na , vo tho thoda sochne ka hi.

translation.en: I can't say for sure but gennifer Goodwin sounds familiar

translation.en: Have you seen any other movies from the director?
